channel.title: "Server is already in use."
channel.description: Lately whenever i try to run my server it says "Server is already in use.", I thought it might just be a coding error but i tried a couple other sources and it kept happening, I went back into files and I made sure i changed server ip and typed it all in correctly but it is still happening. PLEASE HELP thanks. :)

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

This is just sad, just make sure no other program is using the port you have set your server to bind to.

Read full topic

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

[quote=“smokin flax, post:12, topic:390668”][quote author=Derosha22 link=topic=486577.msg3566113#msg3566113 date=1302657997]
@We we we so excited, what else would be using that port…? I got Internet ( Mozilla Firefox), No-ip, and the server folders open that is it and i just restarted comp and i tried the Ctrl + Alt + Del method… Please help

EDIT: Figured it out! I did Ctrl + Alt + Del and ended uTorrent process, thanks for all your guys’ help!
[/quote]
Thought you said you don’t use Utourent?[/quote]

If you have ever downloaded it then it starts at startup so it can use you to seed.

Read full topic

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Like someone said, if you have a javaw.exe running, sometimes they close the window but not the process - so it’s still using the port it was on. Check your processes.

Read full topic

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @Fringe_Division1 Fringe Division
item.description:
@Fringe_Division1 wrote:

make sure your utorrent is closed out and nothing else has access the port.

Read full topic

EDIT: Figured it out! I did Ctrl + Alt + Del and ended uTorrent process, thanks for all your guys’ help![/quote]

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @we_we_we_so_excited we we we so excited
item.description:
@we_we_we_so_excited wrote:

Try closing all processes that could be using that port, and restarting your computer should help.

Read full topic

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @Derosha22 Derosha22
item.description:
@Derosha22 wrote:

@Durial12, I just tryed the Ctr Alt Del method didn’t work but thanks for suggestion, ill try restarting my comp now.

EDIT: just restarted comp and still says same thing, but what other processes would be using same port? I only have internet, No-Ip, and the server folder open…

Read full topic

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

Try restarting your computer. I had this problem once for no apparent reason and after a restart it was fine.

OR

Do CTRL + ALT + DEL and then click processes. Find Java and end process then try again. If not try step 1.

Read full topic

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

Derosha22:

No, I don’t use u Torrent and i checked my port stuff and nothing is on same Ip/port, only things i have running when i run my server is maybe the internet (Mozilla Firefox), a separate client, and No-Ip…

It’s nothing, like that unless you have something that is running on 43594 aswell as your server.

Read full topic

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @Derosha22 Derosha22
item.description:
@Derosha22 wrote:

No, I don’t use u Torrent and i checked my port stuff and nothing is on same Ip/port, only things i have running when i run my server is maybe the internet (Mozilla Firefox), a separate client, maybe a RS bot, and No-Ip…

Read full topic

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Yeah, what the others said above.

Make sure you haven’t portforwarded twice on the same port,
Make sure you have closed Utorrent(Or any other Torrent Program)
Make sure you don’t have two sources running.

That’s all I have for you, but one of these shoudl definately be your problem

Read full topic

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

Do you use Utourent?
If so close out of it completely, then run your server and when
your server is up turn Utourent on.
then close your server and Run again, if you don’t get this i could help you VIA TeamViewer.

Read full topic

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @i_str_pk_i i str pk i
item.description:
@i_str_pk_i wrote:

go back to where u portforwarded (the page) and search for something that might be using the same IP

Read full topic

item.title: "Server is already in use."
item.dc:creator: @Zivearia Zivearia
item.description:
@Zivearia wrote:

You have something else using the same port.
